reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Chestnuts. The owners provided excellent service for our stay and were so friendly. Lovely clean family room and a great choice of breakfast.
reviews.title: Very friendly B&B, in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed Birdland just 5 minutes walk away especially the King Penguins feeding time at 2.30. Great food at Cafe at Birdland too. Also visited Cotswold Farm Park great day (15 mins drive) out for the kids, they loved the playground/inflatable pillow/kids animal corner/ and feeding all the animals.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Cosy, Brilliant Location

reviews.text: We will definitely by booking Chestnuts again and try out some of the lovely walks in the area that we didnt get time to fit in! Thank you Bob and Jan

reviews.text: This B & B, is right in the very centre of Bourton-On-The -Water, in the heard of the Cotswolds, comfortable, nice, rooms. The owners are lovely, and very helpful, and it wasn't too expensive compared to other B&Bs in the area...
reviews.title: Weekend Away

reviews.text: Easy accessible, plenty of parking at the rear. Very close to all facilities. Cosy and comfortable, slightly dated but this adds to the quaint charm. The owners, new since July 2009 I was told, made every effort to be friendly and helpful. Great breakfast.
reviews.title: Cosy, friendly and helpful owners, very central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am afraid to say that I had a horrific experience with this hotel. PLEASE - do not give them your credit card details - especially the three digits on the back of the card. I did and have they proceeded to take money from my bank account. Don't take on trust that they will only use this with discretion. They won't. Protect yourself. My account is now frozen and my cards are being re-issued which is unwanted hassle. They ask for payment in cash and so you do not need to give them these credit card details.
reviews.title: Disaster - avoid this hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this B&B for 2 nights as it was an ideal location for a relative's wedding at the nearby Lower Slaughter Manor. We weren't expecting luxury as it was a reasonably priced £65 per night per room for double occupancy and is a b&b, not a 5* hotel. When we arrived we were given a choice of room, and we chose room 8 - which I think was the nicest room of all! It had a fireplace, was decorated nicely and had a lovely window seat with sash window.
reviews.title: Rooms ok, beds comfy, breakfast poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners seemed friendly and left us to it.
reviews.title: Quiet and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the cooked breakfast was not of a very good standard, I am sorry to say. We had cereal and toast to start with fruit juice and tea and coffee which was all perfectly nice. They had a good selection of jams and spreads available too. However, when it came to the cooked breakfast, it was not consistent. 4 of us ordered the full English, but only 2 of those came with hash brown which confused us. The quality was not very good - the bacon and sausage weren't very nice at all, and the poached eggs were hard on the first day. I couldn't eat the breakfast as it just didn't taste good. however, on the second day, I opted for soft boiled eggs as I thought it would be a safe option, and they were delicious.
reviews.title: Friendly and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I would recommend this B&B as somewhere to be based from to explore Bouron on the Water and the Cotswolds.
reviews.title: Satisfied Customer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this B&B for three nights,we found it to be very quiet considering the amount of tourists in the village,the welcome was warm and friendly,the room had character (uneven floors and out of square doors) but that's what you'd expect in a 300 year old building,breakfasts were fine from cereals,fruit,yoghurt,and full english or whatever you wanted from the menu,more than enough to get you started for the day.Tea and coffee faciiities were provided in the room and milk was always kept in a fridge outside the room so you could brew up anytime.Overall it was a very relaxing stay,would stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B, amazing spot
